courses.subject: IBBA
courses.title: Issues in Business
courses.description: This course provides an opportunity for students to integrate knowledge acquired from their business studies in generating a project/research study with the guidance of a teacher.
courses.learning_outcomes:
Upon completion of this course, students are expected to:

•Understand the business environments, culture and challenges.
•Develop a global mindset and cross-cultural sensitivity.
•Demonstrate effective business communication and presentation skills.
courses.course_syllabus:
This course provides an opportunity for students to integrate knowledge acquired from their business studies with real business issues by examining various business corporations.

Remarks: The Assessment Type below is for reference only. For the specific assessment scheme, please refer to the course outline.
courses.feedback_evaluation: Students can provide comments and feedback to faculty members via email or at meetings or any other measures as needed.

courses.subject: IBBA
courses.title: Corporate Social Responsibilities: Distinguished Speaker Series
courses.description: The course aims to provide students with a general knowledge of Corporate Social Responsibilities (CSR), with special emphasis on the current state of CSR research and common practices through corporate cases.  Senior executives and distinguished CSR practitioners will be invited to conduct seminars on CSR concepts and topics, including Global Reporting Initiative (GRI) and ISO26000, environmental management, consumer values, corporate governance, community involvement, as well as the value and impact of CSR on corporations and the society.
courses.learning_outcomes: Upon completion of this course, students are expected to (1) understand the fundamental concepts of CSR; and (2) be able to appreciate the impact of CSR on a company, its stakeholders and the community at large.
courses.course_syllabus:
Six two-hour seminars

Remarks: The Assessment Type below is for reference only. For the specific assessment scheme, please refer to the course outline.

courses.subject: IBBA
courses.title: Corporate Project
courses.description: This course bridges the gap between classroom and real business world and provides students with first-hand experience on real business problems. Corporate partners will work with CUHK Business School in providing lectures/ workshops and a corporate project for students to work with. Students will be required to work in a team of 4-5 under the guidance of faculty member. Each group will plan a project task and apply business knowledge, problem-solving and analytical skills to real business problems or issues of corporations. Students will be required to conduct a presentation to the corporations and submit reflection paper to faculty member at the end of the course.
courses.learning_outcomes: Upon completion of the course, students will: (1) acquire effective analytical and problem-solving skills that support them to make business decisions; (2) be able to integrate business knowledge in a business environment; (3) have specific knowledge in one or more functional areas of business management.
courses.course_syllabus:
Corporate partners will work with CUHK Business School in providing lectures/ workshops and a corporate project for students to work with. Students will be required to work in a team of 4-5 under the guidance of faculty member. Each group will plan a project task and apply business knowledge, problem-solving and analytical skills to real business problems or issues of corporations. Students will be required to conduct a presentation to the corporations and submit reflection paper to faculty member at the end of the course.

Remarks: The Assessment Type below is for reference only. For the specific assessment scheme, please refer to the course outline.
courses.feedback_evaluation: Students can provide comments and feedback to faculty member via email or at meetings.

courses.subject: IBBA
courses.title: Business Lecture Series
courses.description: This course provides an opportunity for students to meet and interact with leaders from business industries and professions. Successful leaders from business communities will be invited to give business lectures to students. By attending business lectures, students will keep abreast of current development in business sectors and gain valuable insights from different industries. It will also nurture students with forward-looking mindsets and enhance their abilities to give reflections on business issues. Moreover, through these lectures, students can have a better understanding about how business and society interact with each other. This course also helps students in reflecting their career aspirations and identifying their career paths. Lecture topics may cover business and social issues at local and global levels.
courses.learning_outcomes: Upon completion of the course, students should be able to: (1) keep abreast of current development in business sectors and gain valuable insights from different industries; (2) give in-depth reflections on business issues; (3) understand how business and society interact with each other.
courses.course_syllabus:
Successful leaders from business sectors will be invited to deliver lectures to students. Lecture topics may cover business and social issues at local and global levels. During the lectures, students will have an opportunity to interact with the speakers and exchange their views on the lecture topics with the speakers. Through these lectures, students can know more about the current development in business sectors and gain insights from different industries. It will also nurture students with forward-looking mindsets and enhance their abilities to give reflections on business issues. Students will be required to write reflection papers after attending the lectures.

Remarks: The Assessment Type below is for reference only. For the specific assessment scheme, please refer to the course outline.
courses.feedback_evaluation: Students can provide comments and feedback to faculty members via email or at meetings.

courses.subject: IBBA
courses.title: Issues in Asian Business
courses.description: This course provides an opportunity for students to integrate knowledge acquired from their business studies in generating a project/research study on the business issues in Asia with the guidance of a teacher.
courses.learning_outcomes:
Upon completion of this course, students are expected to have:

(1) effective business communication and presentation skills

(2) a specific knowledge in one or more functional area of business management

(3) the ability to propose strategies in a global environment
courses.course_syllabus:
This course provides an opportunity for students to integrate knowledge acquired from their business studies with real business issues in Asia by examining various business corporations in Asian counties.

Remarks: The Assessment Type below is for reference only. For the specfic assessment scheme, please refer to the course outline.
courses.feedback_evaluation: Students are welcomed to provide comments and feedback to the instructor via email and appointment.

courses.subject: IBBA
courses.title: Business Practicum
courses.description: This course provides students the opportunities to put what they learn from programme into action in a business setting. Students are expected to carry out projects under the joint supervision of the instructor and an executive of the sponsoring company and submit a report by the end of the internship period.
courses.learning_outcomes:
1. To develop student’s ability to integrate business knowledge and solve problems in a business environment
2. To develop student’s ability to be aware of the ethical issues in a business context
courses.course_syllabus:
This course connects students to the real business world, students will complete a business project with a business organization. Students will identify issues, make analysis and suggest possible solutions to issues identified of a business organization. The project will be under the joint supervision of an instructor and an executive of the participatory business organization.

Remarks: The Assessment Type below is for reference only. For the specific assessment scheme, please refer to the course outline.
courses.feedback_evaluation: The course will NOT employ the University’s Courses and Teaching Evaluation (CTE) as evaluation tool and reflection collected from individual student would be collated instead to see the effectiveness of the course in delivery of Learning outcomes.
